intro: Aplotaxis leontodontoides, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble those of the common dandelion. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces a capsule-like fruit that contains numerous small seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Aplotaxis leontodontoides is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
